dt: {bc}of or relating to the brain or the intellect
{bc}of, relating to, affecting, or being the {a_link|cerebrum}

et: French {it}cérébral{/it}, from Latin {it}cerebrum{/it} brain; akin to Old High German {it}hirni{/it} brain, Greek {it}kara{/it} head, {it}keras{/it} horn, Sanskrit {it}śiras{/it} head {ma}{mat|horn|}{/ma}
shortdef: of or relating to the brain or the intellect
of, relating to, affecting, or being the cerebrum

dt: {bc}any of the arteries supplying the {d_link|cerebral cortex|cerebral cortex}

dt.t: Ischemic stroke results from a decrease in the blood flow to the brain following a blockage of a {wi}cerebral artery{/wi}.

shortdef: any of the arteries supplying the cerebral cortex

dt: {bc}the convoluted surface layer of gray matter of the cerebrum that functions chiefly in coordination of sensory and motor information {dx}compare {dxt|neocortex||}{/dx}

shortdef: the convoluted surface layer of gray matter of the cerebrum that functions chiefly in coordination of sensory and motor information

dt: {bc}either of the two hollow convoluted lateral halves of the cerebrum {dx}see {dxt|brain|brain|illustration}{/dx}

shortdef: either of the two hollow convoluted lateral halves of the cerebrum

dt: {bc}a disability resulting from damage to the brain before, during, or shortly after birth and outwardly manifested by muscular incoordination and speech disturbances

shortdef: a disability resulting from damage to the brain before, during, or shortly after birth and outwardly manifested by muscular incoordination and speech disturbances
